p: PWID aged 18 years or older, not enrolled in a methadone program, were eligible for inclusion into the study, while recruitment was subject to obtaining written consent. An individual had to admit having injected non-medically sanctioned psychotropic substances such as opioids, amphetamine-type stimulants, cocaine, hypo-sedatives, and hallucinogens either intravenously, intramuscularly or subcutaneously, during the past 30 days. The sample size was estimated to be 155 using Kish Leslie formula, and considering an 11∙3% prevalence of HIV among PWID in Zanzibar [ 6] and a 5% margin of error.
